intro: Scrophularia elata, commonly known as greater horseweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring erect, hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Scrophularia elata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
